main.name: Liuming Huang
main.description: 4th year Computer Science & Data Science student studying in University of Toronto
main.bio: I'm a fourth-year Computer Science & Data Science student with strong problem-solving skills and a desire to explore the tech industry. I love working on new frameworks and making software accessible to all. Proven quick learner with the ability to work under pressure both independently and in a team as seen in the co-op role. Always eager to learn and striving to improve!
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: I always interested in playing aroung with new technologies but these are the ones that have really won me over

description: Double specialist in Computer Science and Data Science
Deanâ€™s List Scholar in the Faculty of Arts and Science

work.title: Software Developer (Remote Internship)
description: Researched in open source projects about Federated Machine Learning and measured the runtime & accuracy of algorithms
Developed a Python Dashboard used by 10 staffs to simply drag & drop datasets
Used Docker Compose to orchestrate multiple containers that work together and set up environments

work.title: QA Automation Engineer Co-op
description: Built automation framework using Selenium and C# to automate testing of web applications
Created new helper functions by using REST API to generate test data, and improved average 50% running time reduction during each test run
Experienced in Agile Development process for diverse requirements

skills.name: Java
skills.description: I have developed several projects using Java. Frameworks like Spring boot also makes developmwent much easier.

skills.name: React Js
skills.description: The most popular frontend framework now. I have built ReactJS based websites such as budget planning website and my personal website.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use Git for all of my projects so far. I have used Git for version control for personal projects and also in teams.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: It is by far the language I am most familiar with in terms of data-structure and algorithm programming. I also use Python for machine learning development.

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.description: I have used many different database systems. However, for many applications, the ease of use of MongoDB better suits my needs and it is much more enjoyable to work with

skills.name: AWS
skills.description: I use AWS Route 53 services to register and manage my domains. I'm also preparing for AWS certified developer associate exam.

skills.name: Node JS
skills.description: Node JS is my server-side scripting language of choice. It makes things easier for building and deploying.

skills.name: Bootstrap 4
skills.description: I use Bootstrap more often than not when designing the layout for my sites. It is the framework I am most familiar with and can therefore design more quickly than with others.

projects.title: Game Center App
projects.category: A game center application consists of three different games

projects.title: Budgeting Web Application
projects.category: Web application to track monthly spent

projects.title: Liver Cancer Subtype Detection Data Analysis
projects.category: Using python & machine learning algorithms to seperate patients into groups.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
